documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to the Schedule of Activities (SoA) for timing of study procedures, assessments, and data collection, cited in sections 3, 7.1, 7.2, 8.2.3, 8.2.4, 8.5, 8.6, and 9.4.3.

documentContentReferences.name: Study Assessments Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the amendment summary table to Section 8 for details on procedures specific to screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to dose modification criteria for safety events, such as elevated transaminases or anemia, cited in sections 2.3.1, 4.1, and 7.1.

documentContentReferences.name: Adverse Event Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to procedures for recording, evaluating, and following up on Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), cited throughout Section 8.3.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Multiple references to the Investigator's Brochure (IB) for background data on risks and nonclinical data, cited in sections 2.3.1 and 4.2.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraceptive Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from lifestyle considerations (Section 5.3) to the section describing appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Eligibility Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Cross-references within the study population section, such as the reference from Lifestyle Considerations (5.3) to Exclusion Criteria (5.2) regarding blood donation.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Discontinuation of Study Intervention and Participant Discontinuation/Withdrawal
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Electrocardiograms section (8.2.3) to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Clinical Safety Laboratory Assessments section (8.2.4) to the list of required laboratory tests.

documentContentReferences.name: Balance Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Cross-references from Pharmacokinetics (8.5) and Biomarkers (8.8) sections to details of copper and molybdenum measurement in food, drink, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference to Table 8 for the definitions of the analysis population sets.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Overall Design (4.1) to the table describing adaptive design features.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Section Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from discontinuation criteria (7.1) to the pregnancy section.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the AE/SAE follow-up section (8.3.3) to the definition of lost to follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetics Section Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the Retained and Biobanked Sample section (8.3.6) clarifying that genetic testing will not be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from section 2.3.1.1 to the section on COVID-19 vaccine risks.

commentAnnotations.text: This amendment is considered to be substantial based on the criteria set forth in Article 10(a) of Directive 2001/20/EC of the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, the US Food and Drug Administration’s (FDA) regulation at 21 CFR part 312.30(b), and any applicable local regulations.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Current protocol version. Clarifies study procedures across US sites to facilitate recruitment.
